message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.AR, cs.SY, cs.DC 

This paper discusses the renovation of radio access networks (RANs) to enable green and elastic wireless access. It covers topics such as control-traffic decoupled air interface, cloud-based RANs, and software-defined RANs, which are all related to networking and information theory (cs.NI, cs.IT). The proposed software-defined hyper-cellular architecture (SDHCA) involves the integration of these trends and requires system-level control and optimization (cs.AR, cs.SY). The paper also discusses the virtualization of base station functions, which is related to distributed computing (cs.DC). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.NI and cs.IT, followed by cs.AR, cs.SY, and cs.DC.
